page.title: 18The George & Dragon, Seaton
page.content:
This is a friendly, warm-hearted pub, serving not only villagers, but also people from Leicester, Kettering and Corby on a regular basis. The landlord, Mrs Muriel Perkins estimates that 90% of her customers come from outside the village. The pub seats 45 people, and 50% of the customers have food as well as drinks.
Years ago the publican cooked meat for the villagers, and because salt was used to preserve the meat, there is still a lot of salt left in the walls of the pub where the ovens used to be. It is yhought that there is a well under the floorboards.
